title: Check your privacy settings
description: Most social networks allow you to control your privacy settings. Ensure that your profile can only be viewed by people who you are in your friends list, and you know personally

title: Only put info on social media that you wouldn’t mind being public
description: Even with tightened security settings, don’t put anything online that you wouldn’t want to be seen by anyone other than your friends. Don’t reply solely on the social networks security

title: Don’t give social networking apps permissions they don’t need
description: By default many of the popular social networking apps, will ask for permission to access your contacts, your call log, your location, your messaging history etc.. If they don’t need this access- don’t grant it

title: Revoke access for apps your no longer using
Remove meta data before uploading media
description: Most smartphones and some cameras automatically attach a comprehensive set of additional data to each photograph., This usually includes things like time, date, location, camera model, user etc. Remove this data before uploading. See this guide for more info

title: Don’t have any social media accounts
description: It may seem a bit extreme, but if your serious about data privacy and security, stay away from entering information on any social media platform
